C:\Users\DAVE\Documents\Visual Studio 2013\Projects\WizardWrx_Libs\DLLServices2\DLLServices2\SpecialStrings.cs(232,17): updated definition
C:\Users\DAVE\Documents\Visual Studio 2013\Projects\WizardWrx_Libs\DLLServices2\DLLServices2\SpecialStrings.cs(234,30): updated reference
C:\Users\DAVE\Documents\Visual Studio 2013\Projects\WizardWrx_Libs\DLLServices2\DLLServices2\SpecialStrings.cs(237,40): updated reference
Looking for symbol references in project 'C:\Users\DAVE\Documents\Visual Studio 2013\Projects\WizardWrx_Libs\DLLServices2\DLLServices2\bin\Debug\WizardWrx.DLLServices2.dll'

        public static string AppendFullStopIfMissing ( string pstrInput )
        {
            const string FULL_STOP_AS_STRING = @".";

            if ( pstrInput.EndsWith ( FULL_STOP_AS_STRING ) )
                return pstrInput;
            else
                return string.Concat ( pstrInput , FULL_STOP_AS_STRING );
        }

        /// <summary>
        /// Evaluate whether a standard handle is attached to a console or
        /// redirected.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="penmStdHandle">
        /// Specify the ShsStandardHandle member that corresponds to the handle
        /// for which you wish to know whether it is attached or redirected.
        /// </param>
        /// <returns>
        /// If the function succeeds, the return value is either ShsAttached or
        /// ShsRedirected. Otherwise, there was an error, and you should call
        /// Marshal.GetLastWin32Error to determine exactly what happened. The
        /// singleton has a private property where the return value is stored.

        /// <summary>
        /// Return the subsystem ID of the specified Portable Executable cast to
        /// a member of the PESubsystemID enumeration, thus clearly documenting
        /// its correct interpretation.
        /// </summary>
        /// Specify the name of the Portable Executable to be tested. The file
        /// name must be specified in such a way that the Win32 CreateFile
        /// routine can open a read only handle on it.

        /// <summary>
        /// Return the subsystem ID of the specified Portable Executable.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="plpExeName">
        /// Specify the name of the Portable Executable to be tested. The file
        /// name must be specified in such a way that the Win32 CreateFile
        /// routine can open a read only handle on it.
        /// </param>
        /// <returns>
        /// The subsystem ID is returned as an unsigned integer.
        /// </returns>
        /// <remarks>
        /// The return value maps to a member of the PESubsystemID enumeration,
        /// which is used internally by XlateProcessSubsystem.
        ///
        /// Since this routine operates on the Portable Executable file named by
        /// its caller, it is immune to the compatibility issues that affect
        /// GetProcessSubsystem.
        ///
        /// If you infer from the reference to CreateFile in the requirements
        /// for argument plpMMainModuleFQFN that this routine imports native
        /// code, you are correct. Rather than develop a managed implementation,
        /// I imported a working native Win32 routine, GetExeSubsystemW_WW,
        /// from a DLL that contains dozens of routines that I have refined over
        /// the last nine years or so.
        ///
        /// Although this routine imports native code, since the code cleans up
        /// after itself before it returns control to its caller, there are no
        /// unmanaged resources to clean up.
        /// </remarks>
        /// <seealso cref="GetExeSubsystemID"/>
        /// <seealso cref="XlateProcessSubsystem"/>
        public static uint GetExeSubsystem ( string plpExeName )

        plpExeName  "C:\\Users\\DAVE\\Documents\\Visual Studio 2013\\Projects\\WizardWrx_Libs\\DLLServices2\\DLLServices2TestStand\\bin\\Debug\\DLLServices2TestStand.exe"  string

        {
            return SafeNativeMethods.GetExeSubsystemW_WW ( plpExeName );

        }   // public static uint GetExeSubsystem


        }   // public static PESubsystemID GetExeSubsystemID

                {

                        return ShsHandleState.ShsAttached;

ShsHandleState.ShsAttached = ShsAttached

                    case ShsHandleState.ShsRedirected:
                        return ShsHandleState.ShsRedirected;
                    case ShsHandleState.ShsUndeterminable:
                        s_dwLastError = Marshal.GetLastWin32Error ( );
                        return ShsHandleState.ShsUndeterminable;
                    default:
                        s_dwLastError = Marshal.GetLastWin32Error ( );
                        return ShsHandleState.ShsSystemError;
                }   // switch ( ( ShsHandleState ) SafeNativeMethods.SHS_StandardHandleState ( ( uint ) penmStdHandle ) )
            }   // TRUE (anticipated outcome) block, if ( IP6CUtilLib1.GetExeSubsystemID ( System.Reflection.Assembly.GetEntryAssembly ( ).Location ) == IP6CUtilLib1.PESubsystemID.IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_WINDOWS_CUI )
            else
            {
                s_dwLastError = StateManager.UNSUPPORTED_EXE_SUBSYSTEM;
                return ShsHandleState.ShsSystemError;
            }   // FALSE (unanticipated outcome) block, if ( IP6CUtilLib1.GetExeSubsystemID ( System.Reflection.Assembly.GetEntryAssembly ( ).Location ) == IP6CUtilLib1.PESubsystemID.IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_WINDOWS_CUI )
        }   // public static ShsHandleState StandardHandleState


        private static string ConsoleHandleStateMessage ( StateManager.ShsHandleState shsHandleState )

        shsHandleState  ShsAttached WizardWrx.DLLServices2.StateManager.ShsHandleState

        {
            switch ( shsHandleState )
            {
                case StateManager.ShsHandleState.ShsAttached:
                    return Properties.Resources.MSG_HANDLE_IS_ATTACHED;

Properties.Resources.MSG_HANDLE_IS_ATTACHED = "attached to a console"

                case StateManager.ShsHandleState.ShsRedirected:
                    return Properties.Resources.MSG_HANDLE_IS_REDIRECTED;
                default:
                    return Properties.Resources.MSG_HANDLE_IS_UNDEFINED;
            }   // switch ( shsHandleState )
        }   // private static string ConsoleHandleStateMessage

        /// <summary>
        /// Report the file, if any, to which the specified standard handle is
        /// redirected.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="penmStdHandle">
        /// Specify the ShsStandardHandle member that corresponds to the handle
        /// for which you wish to know whether it is attached or redirected.
        /// </param>
        /// <returns>
        /// If the function succeeds and the handle is redirected, the return
        /// value is the name of the file to which the specified handle is
        /// redirected.
        ///
        /// Otherwise, the return value is one of two strings that explain the
        /// error.
        ///
        /// Properties.Resources.MSG_APP_CHARACTER_MODE_APPS_ONLY is the
        /// complete text of the message displayed when the calling routine is
        /// running in the Windows graphical mode subsystem.
        ///
        /// Properties.Resources.ERRMSG_STD_HANDLE_STATE is the beginning of a
        /// message, which is followed by the returned system status code, shown
        /// in both hexadecimal and decimal notation, followed by the associated
        /// system message.
        /// </returns>
        public static string GetStdHandleFQFN ( ShsStandardHandle penmStdHandle )

        penmStdHandle   ShSStdIn    WizardWrx.DLLServices2.StateManager.ShsStandardHandle

        {
            switch ( StandardHandleState ( penmStdHandle ) )
            {
                case ShsHandleState.ShsRedirected:
                    return SafeNativeMethods.SHS_GetStdHandleFNW ( ( uint ) penmStdHandle , 10 );
                case ShsHandleState.ShsAttached:
                    return Properties.Resources.MSG_CONSOLE_HAS_STD_HANDLE;

Properties.Resources.MSG_CONSOLE_HAS_STD_HANDLE = "The handle is attached to its console (NOT redirected)."

                default:
                    if ( s_dwLastError == UNSUPPORTED_EXE_SUBSYSTEM )
                    {   // Console mode callers only, please!
                        return Properties.Resources.MSG_APP_CHARACTER_MODE_APPS_ONLY;
                    }   // TRUE (most likely outcome) block, if ( s_dwLastError ==  UNSUPPORTED_EXE_SUBSYSTEM)
                    else
                    {   // Something completely unexpected happened.
                        return string.Format (
                            Properties.Resources.ERRMSG_STD_HANDLE_STATE ,
                            s_dwLastError.ToString ( DisplayFormats.HEXADECIMAL_8 ) ,
                            s_dwLastError.ToString ( DisplayFormats.NUMBER_PER_REG_SETTINGS_0D ) ,
                            FormatSystemErrorMessage ( s_dwLastError ) );
                    }   // FALSE (least likely outcome) block, if ( s_dwLastError ==  UNSUPPORTED_EXE_SUBSYSTEM)
            }   // switch ( StandardHandleState ( penmStdHandle ) )
        }   // GetStdHandleFQFN

        #region AppendFullStopIfMissing Method
        /// <summary>
        /// Unless the last character of the input string is a period (full
        /// stop), append one to the returned string.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="pstrInput">
        /// Specify the input string to evaluate and edit as needed.
        /// </param>
        /// <returns>
        /// The input string is returned with a period appended to it. If it already
        /// has one, the input string is returned without changes.
        /// </returns>
        public static string AppendFullStopIfMissing ( string pstrInput )
        {
            const string FULL_STOP_AS_STRING = @".";

            if ( pstrInput.EndsWith ( FULL_STOP_AS_STRING ) )
                return pstrInput;
            else
                return string.Concat ( pstrInput , FULL_STOP_AS_STRING );
        }   // public static string AppendFullStopIfMissing
        #endregion  // AppendFullStopIfMissing Method

        pstrInput           "Console handle Standard Input (STDIN, a. k. a., Console.In) is attached to a console to The handle is attached to its console (NOT redirected)."   string
        FULL_STOP_AS_STRING "."                                                                                                                                                 string

                           stack.
    ============================================================================
*/
    LPTSTR SHS_STANDARDHANDLESTATE_API SHS_GetStdHandleFNW
        (
            CSHS_STANDARD_HANDLE penmStdHandleID ,                              // Specify the desired standard stream.
            CUINT                puintBufferID                                  // Specify the zero based index of the buffer whose address you need.
        ) ;

        (
            CSHS_STANDARD_HANDLE penmStdHandleID ,                              // Specify the desired standard stream.

        ) ;

    61:
    62:     //  ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    63:     //  Macro LoadStringIntoBuf_CUI_WW calls LoadString, using the specified
    64:     //  standard fixed buffer, resource string ID, and instance handle. Hence,
    65:     //  it can load string resources from anywhere.
    66:     //
    67:     //  PuintBufferID values FB_ERROR_MESSAGE_BUFFER or FB_FORMAT_MESSAGE_BUFFER
    68:     //  are magic numbers that direct FB_LoadString to use two buffers that are
    69:     //  completely hidden from the outside world, since neither is listed in the
    70:     //  array of buffer addresses. Beginning with version 1.4.0.1, there are two
    71:     //  additional buffers, both included in the array, but hidden from the
    72:     //  outside world by the bounds checkers that enforce upper limits on buffer
    73:     //  index numbers.
    74:     //  ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    75:

     9: #define WWCA_TS_FORCE_COTASKMALLOC  ( FB_STRING_BUFFER_INDEX_5_OF_5 + ARRAY_NEXT_ELEMENT_P6C )

66054ADE  pop         ebx                                                       ; EBX=7EFDE000    Restore the caller's EBX register, which we didn't use, either.                                                             ESP=003CFBE4
66054ADF  add         esp,0C0h                                                  ; ESP=003CFCA4    Surrender the buffer that we didn't touch, either, other than to initialize it.                                             ESP=003CFCA4

66054AE7  call        _RTC_CheckEsp (660562F0h)                                 ; EBP=003CFCA4    Under these conditions, _RTC_CheckEsp returns immediately.                                                                  ESP=003CFCA4
66054AEC  mov         esp,ebp                                                   ; EBP=003CFCA4    The effect of this instruction is negligible. The only affected register is the Flags register.                             ESP=003CFCA4
66054AEE  pop         ebp                                                       ; EBP=003CFDA4    Restoring the caller's base pointer paves the way for our shiny new __stdcall no muss, no fuss return.                      ESP=003CFCA8
66054AEF  ret         4                                                         ; ESP=003CFCB0    Unlike the __cdecl returns that always add 4 to the stack pointer, __stdcall adds another 4 for each argument.              ESP=003CFCB0

2015-10-16 02:21:11

------------------------------------
SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI Argument List:
------------------------------------

        penmStdHandleID SHS_INPUT (0x00000001)  _SHS_STANDARD_HANDLE

---------------------------------------------------------
CPU Registers on Entry to SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI Prologue:
---------------------------------------------------------

EAX=00225F30
EBX=003C27D0
ECX=6E60606A
EDX=0034E9CC

ESI=0034E9CC
EDI=0034F010

EIP=57523DA0

ESP=0034E970
EBP=0034E9B4

EFL=00000246

    46: LPTSTR SHS_STANDARDHANDLESTATE_API  __stdcall   SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI
    47: (
    48:     CSHS_STANDARD_HANDLE penmStdHandleID                                        // Specify the desired standard stream.
    49: )
    50: {
57523DA0  push        ebp
57523DA1  mov         ebp,esp
57523DA3  sub         esp,0C0h
57523DA9  push        ebx
57523DAA  push        esi
57523DAB  push        edi
     1: //  ============================================================================
     2: //  File Name:  SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI.C
     3: //
     4: //  Abstract:   This routine is a wrapper for SHS_GetStdHandleFNW, which is
     5: //              decorated with __declspec ( DllExport ), but is devoid of a
     6: //              calling convention designation and, hence, adheres to the old
     7: //              __cdecl calling convention. Though I could live with that,
     8: //              since the default calling convention of a Platform Invoke thunk
     9: //              is __stdcall, I wrote this wrapper, so that I wouldn't have to
    10: //              disturb the existing calls to SHS_GetStdHandleFNW.
    11: //
    12: //  Remarks:    The other reason for leaving the existing function prototypes is
    13: //              that it enabled me to build a test case to demonstrate my better
    14: //              DLL header.
    15: //  ============================================================================
    16:
    17: //  ============================================================================
    18: //  2015/10/15: The objective of the following comment is to strip the
    19: //              decorations from the function name when the linkage editor
    20: //              generates the table of exports. Initially, this edit was
    21: //              applied to GetOsVersionInfo, while SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI seemed
    22: //              to link without it. But, alas, no more!
    23: //
    24: //              IMPORTANT:  The spacing of this comment is very particular. The
    25: //                          white space that I prefer to put around parentheses
    26: //                          and commas breaks it. As straightforward as this one
    27: //                          is, I can live with the limitation.
    28: //  ============================================================================
    29:
    30: #pragma comment(linker, "/EXPORT:SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI=_SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI@4")
    31:
    32: #define UNICODE
    33:
    34: #if !defined ( __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__ )
    35:     #define __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__
    36: #endif /* #if !defined ( __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__) */
    37:
    38: #define __WWCONAID_BUILDING_STDIN_WRAPPERS__
    39:
    40: #include <StandardHandleState.H>
    41: #include ".\WWConAid_Pvt.H"
    42: #include ".\resource.h"
    43:
    44: #define WWCA_TS_FORCE_COTASKMALLOC  ( FB_STRING_BUFFER_INDEX_5_OF_5 + ARRAY_NEXT_ELEMENT_P6C )
    45:
    46: LPTSTR SHS_STANDARDHANDLESTATE_API  __stdcall   SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI
    47: (
    48:     CSHS_STANDARD_HANDLE penmStdHandleID                                        // Specify the desired standard stream.
    49: )
    50: {

    50: {
57F73DA0  push        ebp                                                       ; EBP=0046ED34                                                                                                                                ESP=0046ECEC
57F73DA1  mov         ebp,esp                                                   ; EBP=0046ECEC                                                                                                                                ESP=0046ECEC
57F73DA3  sub         esp,0C0h                                                  ; ESP=0046EC2C                                                                                                                                ESP=0046EC2C
57F73DA9  push        ebx                                                       ; EBX=005225C0                                                                                                                                ESP=0046EC28
57F73DAA  push        esi                                                       ; ESI=0046ED4C                                                                                                                                ESP=0046EC24
57F73DAB  push        edi                                                       ; EDI=0046F398                                                                                                                                ESP=0046EC20
     1: //  ============================================================================
     2: //  File Name:  SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI.C
     3: //
     4: //  Abstract:   This routine is a wrapper for SHS_GetStdHandleFNW, which is
     5: //              decorated with __declspec ( DllExport ), but is devoid of a
     6: //              calling convention designation and, hence, adheres to the old
     7: //              __cdecl calling convention. Though I could live with that,
     8: //              since the default calling convention of a Platform Invoke thunk
     9: //              is __stdcall, I wrote this wrapper, so that I wouldn't have to
    10: //              disturb the existing calls to SHS_GetStdHandleFNW.
    11: //
    12: //  Remarks:    The other reason for leaving the existing function prototypes is
    13: //              that it enabled me to build a test case to demonstrate my better
    14: //              DLL header.
    15: //  ============================================================================
    16:
    17: //  ============================================================================
    18: //  2015/10/15: The objective of the following comment is to strip the
    19: //              decorations from the function name when the linkage editor
    20: //              generates the table of exports. Initially, this edit was
    21: //              applied to GetOsVersionInfo, while SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI seemed
    22: //              to link without it. But, alas, no more!
    23: //
    24: //              IMPORTANT:  The spacing of this comment is very particular. The
    25: //                          white space that I prefer to put around parentheses
    26: //                          and commas breaks it. As straightforward as this one
    27: //                          is, I can live with the limitation.
    28: //  ============================================================================
    29:
    30: #pragma comment(linker, "/EXPORT:SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI=_SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI@4")
    31:
    32: #define UNICODE
    33:
    34: #if !defined ( __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__ )
    35:     #define __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__
    36: #endif /* #if !defined ( __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__) */
    37:
    38: #define __WWCONAID_BUILDING_STDIN_WRAPPERS__
    39:
    40: #include <StandardHandleState.H>
    41: #include ".\WWConAid_Pvt.H"
    42: #include ".\resource.h"
    43:
    44: #define WWCA_TS_FORCE_COTASKMALLOC  ( FB_STRING_BUFFER_INDEX_5_OF_5 + ARRAY_NEXT_ELEMENT_P6C )
    45:
    46: LPTSTR SHS_STANDARDHANDLESTATE_API  __stdcall   SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI
    47: (
    48:     CSHS_STANDARD_HANDLE penmStdHandleID                                        // Specify the desired standard stream.
    49: )

57F73DCE  pop         ebx                                                       ; EBX=005225C0    = Restore the unchanged EBX register.                                                                                       ESP=0046EC2C
57F73DCF  add         esp,0C0h                                                  ; ESP=0046ECEC    = Return our working storagge, which we never used.                                                                         ESP=0046ECEC
57F73DD5  cmp         ebp,esp                                                   ; EBP=0046ECEC    = Check the state of the stack frame. At this point, ESP and EBP should be equal.                                           ESP=0046ECEC

        penmStdHandleID                 SHS_INPUT (0x00000001)                                                                                                          _SHS_STANDARD_HANDLE

--- c:\users\dave\documents\programming\visual_studio_6\dll\wwconaid\shs_getstdhandlefncli.c
     1: //  ============================================================================
     2: //  File Name:          SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI.C
     3: //
     4: //  Abstract:           This routine is a wrapper for SHS_GetStdHandleFNW, which
     5: //                      is decorated with __declspec ( DllExport ), but is
     6: //                      devoid of a calling convention designation and, hence,
     7: //                      adheres to the old __cdecl calling convention. Though I
     8: //                      could live with that, since the default calling
     9: //                      convention of a Platform Invoke thunk is __stdcall, I
    10: //                      wrote this wrapper, so that I wouldn't have to disturb
    11: //                      the existing calls to SHS_GetStdHandleFNW.
    12: //
    13: //  Remarks:            Since it was created specifically to support a managed
    14: //                      caller, SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI saves LastError into a
    15: //                      module variable , and provides SHS_GetStdHandleFNError,
    16: //                      in lieu of the managed wrapper, for retrieving it.
    17: //
    18: //                      The other reason for leaving the existing function
    19: //                      prototypes is that it made a nice test case to prove and
    20: //                      demonstrate my better DLL header.
    21: //  ============================================================================
    22:
    23: //  ============================================================================
    24: //  2015/10/15: The objective of the following comment is to strip the
    25: //              decorations from the function name when the linkage editor
    26: //              generates the table of exports. Initially, this edit was
    27: //              applied to GetOsVersionInfo, while SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI seemed
    28: //              to link without it. But, alas, no more!
    29: //
    30: //              IMPORTANT:  The spacing of this comment is very particular. The
    31: //                          white space that I prefer to put around parentheses
    32: //                          and commas breaks it. As straightforward as this one
    33: //                          is, I can live with the limitation.
    34: //  ============================================================================
    35:
    36: #pragma comment(linker, "/EXPORT:SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI=_SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI@4")
    37: #pragma comment(linker, "/EXPORT:SHS_GetStdHandleFNError=_SHS_GetStdHandleFNError@0")
    38:
    39: #define UNICODE
    40:
    41: #if !defined ( __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__ )
    42:     #define __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__
    43: #endif /* #if !defined ( __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__) */
    44:
    45: #define __WWCONAID_BUILDING_STDIN_WRAPPERS__
    46:
    47: #include <StandardHandleState.H>
    48: #include ".\WWConAid_Pvt.H"
    49: #include ".\resource.h"
    50:
    51: #define WWCA_TS_FORCE_COTASKMALLOC  ( FB_STRING_BUFFER_INDEX_5_OF_5 + ARRAY_NEXT_ELEMENT_P6C )
    52:
    53: static DWORD m_dwLastError = ERROR_SUCCESS ;
    54:
    55: LPWSTR SHS_STANDARDHANDLESTATE_API  __stdcall   SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI

002A5928  push        ebp                                                       ; EBP=003EEB20    Save the caller's base pointer.                                                                                             ESP=003EEAE4

002A592E  mov         dword ptr [ebp-4],ecx                                     ; Leave a copy of puintStdHandleID  = 0x00000001    uint at ebp-04h = 0x003eeae0=00000000, using 1 machine word, leaving 5 so far unused.

--- c:\users\dave\documents\programming\visual_studio_6\dll\wwconaid\shs_getstdhandlefncli.c
     1: //  ============================================================================
     2: //  File Name:          SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI.C
     3: //
     4: //  Abstract:           This routine is a wrapper for SHS_GetStdHandleFNW, which
     5: //                      is decorated with __declspec ( DllExport ), but is
     6: //                      devoid of a calling convention designation and, hence,
     7: //                      adheres to the old __cdecl calling convention. Though I
     8: //                      could live with that, since the default calling
     9: //                      convention of a Platform Invoke thunk is __stdcall, I
    10: //                      wrote this wrapper, so that I wouldn't have to disturb
    11: //                      the existing calls to SHS_GetStdHandleFNW.
    12: //
    13: //  Remarks:            Since it was created specifically to support a managed
    14: //                      caller, SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI saves LastError into a
    15: //                      module variable , and provides SHS_GetStdHandleFNError,
    16: //                      in lieu of the managed wrapper, for retrieving it.
    17: //
    18: //                      The other reason for leaving the existing function
    19: //                      prototypes is that it made a nice test case to prove and
    20: //                      demonstrate my better DLL header.
    21: //  ============================================================================
    22:
    23: //  ============================================================================
    24: //  2015/10/15: The objective of the following comment is to strip the
    25: //              decorations from the function name when the linkage editor
    26: //              generates the table of exports. Initially, this edit was
    27: //              applied to GetOsVersionInfo, while SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI seemed
    28: //              to link without it. But, alas, no more!
    29: //
    30: //              IMPORTANT:  The spacing of this comment is very particular. The
    31: //                          white space that I prefer to put around parentheses
    32: //                          and commas breaks it. As straightforward as this one
    33: //                          is, I can live with the limitation.
    34: //  ============================================================================
    35:
    36: #pragma comment(linker, "/EXPORT:SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI=_SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI@4")
    37: #pragma comment(linker, "/EXPORT:SHS_GetStdHandleFNError=_SHS_GetStdHandleFNError@0")
    38:
    39: #define UNICODE
    40:
    41: #if !defined ( __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__ )
    42:     #define __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__
    43: #endif /* #if !defined ( __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__) */
    44:
    45: #define __WWCONAID_BUILDING_STDIN_WRAPPERS__
    46:
    47: #include <StandardHandleState.H>
    48: #include ".\WWConAid_Pvt.H"
    49: #include ".\resource.h"
    50:
    51: #define WWCA_TS_FORCE_COTASKMALLOC  ( FB_STRING_BUFFER_INDEX_5_OF_5 + ARRAY_NEXT_ELEMENT_P6C )
    52:
    53: static DWORD m_dwLastError = ERROR_SUCCESS ;
    54:
    55: LPWSTR SHS_STANDARDHANDLESTATE_API  __stdcall   SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI
    56: (
    57:     CSHS_STANDARD_HANDLE penmStdHandleID                                        // Specify the desired standard stream.
    58: )

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
>   WWConAid.dll!SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI(const _SHS_STANDARD_HANDLE penmStdHandleID) Line 59  C:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

EBP=003EEAA4

EFL=00000246  <<--- This value is unchanged.

    59: {
74FE3E60  push        ebp                                                       ; EBP=003EEAA4    Save the caller's base pointer. (The caller is the platform invoke thunk.)                                                  ESP=003EEA7C
74FE3E61  mov         ebp,esp                                                   ; EBP=003EEA7C    Make the current stack pointer our base pointer, and assign it to guard the caller's base pointer.                          ESP=003EEA7C
74FE3E63  push        0FFFFFFFEh                                                ; Initialize the Structured Exception Handler flag in the OFF position.                                                                         ESP=003EEA78
74FE3E65  push        74FE8E48h                                                 ;                                                                                                                                               ESP=003EEA74
74FE3E6A  push        74FE5C00h                                                 ;                                                                                                                                               ESP=003EEA74
74FE3E6F  mov         eax,dword ptr fs:[00000000h]                              ; EAX=003EEF2C
     1: //  ============================================================================
     2: //  File Name:          SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI.C
     3: //
     4: //  Abstract:           This routine is a wrapper for SHS_GetStdHandleFNW, which
     5: //                      is decorated with __declspec ( DllExport ), but is
     6: //                      devoid of a calling convention designation and, hence,
     7: //                      adheres to the old __cdecl calling convention. Though I

    14: //                      caller, SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI saves LastError into a

    20: //                      demonstrate my better DLL header.
    21: //  ============================================================================
    22:
    23: //  ============================================================================
    24: //  2015/10/15: The objective of the following comment is to strip the
    25: //              decorations from the function name when the linkage editor
    26: //              generates the table of exports. Initially, this edit was
    27: //              applied to GetOsVersionInfo, while SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI seemed
    28: //              to link without it. But, alas, no more!
    29: //
    30: //              IMPORTANT:  The spacing of this comment is very particular. The
    31: //                          white space that I prefer to put around parentheses
    32: //                          and commas breaks it. As straightforward as this one
    33: //                          is, I can live with the limitation.
    34: //  ============================================================================
    35:
    36: #pragma comment(linker, "/EXPORT:SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI=_SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI@4")
    37: #pragma comment(linker, "/EXPORT:SHS_GetStdHandleFNError=_SHS_GetStdHandleFNError@0")
    38:
    39: #define UNICODE
    40:
    41: #if !defined ( __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__ )
    42:     #define __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__
    43: #endif /* #if !defined ( __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__) */
    44:
    45: #define __WWCONAID_BUILDING_STDIN_WRAPPERS__
    46:
    47: #include <StandardHandleState.H>
    48: #include ".\WWConAid_Pvt.H"
    49: #include ".\resource.h"
    50:
    51: #define WWCA_TS_FORCE_COTASKMALLOC  ( FB_STRING_BUFFER_INDEX_5_OF_5 + ARRAY_NEXT_ELEMENT_P6C )
    52:
    53: static DWORD m_dwLastError = ERROR_SUCCESS ;
    54:
    55: LPWSTR SHS_STANDARDHANDLESTATE_API  __stdcall   SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI
    56: (
    57:     CSHS_STANDARD_HANDLE penmStdHandleID                                        // Specify the desired standard stream.

--------------
Argument List:

        penmStdHandleID SHS_INPUT (0x00000001)  _SHS_STANDARD_HANDLE

--- c:\users\dave\documents\programming\visual_studio_6\dll\wwconaid\shs_getstdhandlefncli.c
     1: //  ============================================================================
     2: //  File Name:          SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI.C
     3: //
     4: //  Abstract:           This routine is a wrapper for SHS_GetStdHandleFNW, which
     5: //                      is decorated with __declspec ( DllExport ), but is
     6: //                      devoid of a calling convention designation and, hence,
     7: //                      adheres to the old __cdecl calling convention. Though I
     8: //                      could live with that, since the default calling
     9: //                      convention of a Platform Invoke thunk is __stdcall, I
    10: //                      wrote this wrapper, so that I wouldn't have to disturb
    11: //                      the existing calls to SHS_GetStdHandleFNW.
    12: //
    13: //  Remarks:            Since it was created specifically to support a managed
    14: //                      caller, SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI saves LastError into a
    15: //                      module variable , and provides SHS_GetStdHandleFNError,
    16: //                      in lieu of the managed wrapper, for retrieving it.
    17: //
    18: //                      The other reason for leaving the existing function
    19: //                      prototypes is that it made a nice test case to prove and
    20: //                      demonstrate my better DLL header.
    21: //  ============================================================================
    22:
    23: //  ============================================================================
    24: //  2015/10/15: The objective of the following comment is to strip the
    25: //              decorations from the function name when the linkage editor
    26: //              generates the table of exports. Initially, this edit was
    27: //              applied to GetOsVersionInfo, while SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI seemed
    28: //              to link without it. But, alas, no more!
    29: //
    30: //              IMPORTANT:  The spacing of this comment is very particular. The
    31: //                          white space that I prefer to put around parentheses
    32: //                          and commas breaks it. As straightforward as this one
    33: //                          is, I can live with the limitation.
    34: //  ============================================================================
    35:
    36: #pragma comment(linker, "/EXPORT:SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI=_SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI@4")
    37: #pragma comment(linker, "/EXPORT:SHS_GetStdHandleFNError=_SHS_GetStdHandleFNError@0")
    38:
    39: #define UNICODE
    40:
    41: #if !defined ( __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__ )
    42:     #define __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__
    43: #endif /* #if !defined ( __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__) */
    44:
    45: #define __WWCONAID_BUILDING_STDIN_WRAPPERS__
    46:
    47: #include <StandardHandleState.H>
    48: #include ".\WWConAid_Pvt.H"
    49: #include ".\resource.h"
    50:
    51: #define WWCA_TS_FORCE_COTASKMALLOC  ( FB_STRING_BUFFER_INDEX_5_OF_5 + ARRAY_NEXT_ELEMENT_P6C )
    52:
    53: static DWORD m_dwLastError = ERROR_SUCCESS ;
    54:
    55: LPWSTR SHS_STANDARDHANDLESTATE_API  __stdcall   SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI
    56: (
    57:     CSHS_STANDARD_HANDLE penmStdHandleID                                        // Specify the desired standard stream.
    58: )

    59: {
50013E60  push        ebp                                                       ; EBP=0022E8C4                                                                                                                                ESP=0022E89C
50013E61  mov         ebp,esp                                                   ; EBP=0022E89C                                                                                                                                ESP=0022E89C
50013E63  push        0FFFFFFFEh                                                ;                                                                                                                                               ESP=0022E898
50013E65  push        50018E48h                                                 ;                                                                                                                                               ESP=0022E894
50013E6A  push        50015C00h                                                 ;                                                                                                                                               ESP=0022E890
50013E6F  mov         eax,dword ptr fs:[00000000h]                              ; EAX=0022ED4C
     1: //  ============================================================================
     2: //  File Name:          SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI.C
     3: //
     4: //  Abstract:           This routine is a wrapper for SHS_GetStdHandleFNW, which
     5: //                      is decorated with __declspec ( DllExport ), but is
     6: //                      devoid of a calling convention designation and, hence,
     7: //                      adheres to the old __cdecl calling convention. Though I
     8: //                      could live with that, since the default calling
     9: //                      convention of a Platform Invoke thunk is __stdcall, I
    10: //                      wrote this wrapper, so that I wouldn't have to disturb
    11: //                      the existing calls to SHS_GetStdHandleFNW.
    12: //
    13: //  Remarks:            Since it was created specifically to support a managed
    14: //                      caller, SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI saves LastError into a
    15: //                      module variable , and provides SHS_GetStdHandleFNError,
    16: //                      in lieu of the managed wrapper, for retrieving it.
    17: //
    18: //                      The other reason for leaving the existing function
    19: //                      prototypes is that it made a nice test case to prove and
    20: //                      demonstrate my better DLL header.
    21: //  ============================================================================
    22:
    23: //  ============================================================================
    24: //  2015/10/15: The objective of the following comment is to strip the
    25: //              decorations from the function name when the linkage editor
    26: //              generates the table of exports. Initially, this edit was
    27: //              applied to GetOsVersionInfo, while SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI seemed
    28: //              to link without it. But, alas, no more!
    29: //
    30: //              IMPORTANT:  The spacing of this comment is very particular. The
    31: //                          white space that I prefer to put around parentheses
    32: //                          and commas breaks it. As straightforward as this one
    33: //                          is, I can live with the limitation.
    34: //  ============================================================================
    35:
    36: #pragma comment(linker, "/EXPORT:SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI=_SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI@4")
    37: #pragma comment(linker, "/EXPORT:SHS_GetStdHandleFNError=_SHS_GetStdHandleFNError@0")
    38:
    39: #define UNICODE
    40:
    41: #if !defined ( __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__ )
    42:     #define __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__
    43: #endif /* #if !defined ( __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__) */
    44:
    45: #define __WWCONAID_BUILDING_STDIN_WRAPPERS__
    46:
    47: #include <StandardHandleState.H>
    48: #include ".\WWConAid_Pvt.H"
    49: #include ".\resource.h"
    50:
    51: #define WWCA_TS_FORCE_COTASKMALLOC  ( FB_STRING_BUFFER_INDEX_5_OF_5 + ARRAY_NEXT_ELEMENT_P6C )
    52:
    53: static DWORD m_dwLastError = ERROR_SUCCESS ;
    54:
    55: LPWSTR SHS_STANDARDHANDLESTATE_API  __stdcall   SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI
    56: (
    57:     CSHS_STANDARD_HANDLE penmStdHandleID                                        // Specify the desired standard stream.
    58: )
    59: {
50013E75  push        eax                                                       ; EAX=0022ED4C                                                                                                                                ESP=0022E88C
50013E76  add         esp,0FFFFFF2Ch                                            ; ESP=0022E7B8    Appropriate 0D4h = 212 bytes (035h = 53 machine words)                                                                      ESP=0022E7B8
50013E7C  push        ebx                                                       ; EBX=006625C0                                                                                                                                ESP=0022E7B4
50013E7D  push        esi                                                       ; ESI=0022E8DC                                                                                                                                ESP=0022E7B0
50013E7E  push        edi                                                       ; EDI=0022EF48                                                                                                                                ESP=0022E7AC
50013E7F  lea         edi,[ebp-0E4h]                                            ; EDI=0022E7B8    Point EDI to ebp-0E4h = ebp-228 bytes, the bottom of our working storage.
50013E85  mov         ecx,33h                                                   ; ECX=00000033

--- c:\users\dave\documents\programming\visual_studio_6\dll\wwconaid\shs_getstdhandlefncli.c
     1: //  ============================================================================
     2: //  File Name:          SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI.C
     3: //
     4: //  Abstract:           This routine is a wrapper for SHS_GetStdHandleFNW, which
     5: //                      is decorated with __declspec ( DllExport ), but is
     6: //                      devoid of a calling convention designation and, hence,
     7: //                      adheres to the old __cdecl calling convention. Though I
     8: //                      could live with that, since the default calling
     9: //                      convention of a Platform Invoke thunk is __stdcall, I
    10: //                      wrote this wrapper, so that I wouldn't have to disturb
    11: //                      the existing calls to SHS_GetStdHandleFNW.
    12: //
    13: //  Remarks:            Since it was created specifically to support a managed
    14: //                      caller, SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI saves LastError into a
    15: //                      module variable, and provides SHS_GetStdHandleFNError,
    16: //                      in lieu of the managed wrapper, for retrieving it.
    17: //
    18: //                      The other reason for leaving the existing function
    19: //                      prototypes is that it made a nice test case to prove and
    20: //                      demonstrate my better DLL header.
    21: //  ============================================================================
    22:
    23: //  ============================================================================
    24: //  2015/10/15: The objective of the following comment is to strip the
    25: //              decorations from the function name when the linkage editor
    26: //              generates the table of exports. Initially, this edit was
    27: //              applied to GetOsVersionInfo, while SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI seemed
    28: //              to link without it. But, alas, no more!
    29: //
    30: //              IMPORTANT:  The spacing of this comment is very particular. The
    31: //                          white space that I prefer to put around parentheses
    32: //                          and commas breaks it. As straightforward as this one
    33: //                          is, I can live with the limitation.
    34: //  ============================================================================
    35:
    36: #pragma comment(linker, "/EXPORT:SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI=_SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI@4")
    37: #pragma comment(linker, "/EXPORT:SHS_GetStdHandleFNError=_SHS_GetStdHandleFNError@0")
    38:
    39: #define UNICODE
    40:
    41: #if !defined ( __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__ )
    42:     #define __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__
    43: #endif /* #if !defined ( __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__) */
    44:
    45: #define __WWCONAID_BUILDING_STDIN_WRAPPERS__
    46:
    47: #include <StandardHandleState.H>
    48: #include ".\WWConAid_Pvt.H"
    49: #include <OleAuto.h>
    50: #include ".\resource.h"
    51:
    52: #define WWCA_TS_FORCE_COTASKMALLOC  ( FB_STRING_BUFFER_INDEX_5_OF_5 + ARRAY_NEXT_ELEMENT_P6C )
    53:
    54: static DWORD m_dwLastError = ERROR_SUCCESS ;
    55:
    56: BSTR SHS_STANDARDHANDLESTATE_API    __stdcall   SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI

+       lpSprintFBuffer         0x00000000 <NULL>                                       char *

--- c:\users\dave\documents\programming\visual_studio_6\dll\wwconaid\wwconaid.c
     1: /*
     2:     ============================================================================
     3:
     4:     File Name:          WWConAid.C
     5:
     6:     File Synopsis:      This file defines the entry point routine and library
     7:                         scope storage for WWConAid.dll, a library of routines to
     8:                         support console mode applications written in C and C++.
     9:
    10:     Remarks:            The initial set of routines that are going into this
    11:                         library were created and tested in various console mode
    12:                         applications. Moving them into this library consolidates
    13:                         the code and eliminates redundant routines, reducing my
    14:                         maintenance effort and the overall size of my code base.
    15:
    16:     Author:             David A. Gray
    17:
    18:     Copyright:          Since this is a standard DLL entry point routine that
    19:                         isn't all that special, I assert no copyright on the
    20:                         code defined herein. Don't bother looking here for my
    21:                         rocket science, because there isn't any.
    22:     ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    23:     Revision History
    24:     ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    25:
    26:     Date       Version By  Synopsis
    27:     ---------- ------- --- -----------------------------------------------------
    28:     2012/06/24         DAG Consolidate existing console helper routines into
    29:                            this DLL.
    30:     2012/08/06         DAG Slightly improve the efficiency of DllMain.
    31:     2013/03/10         DAG Define preprocessor symbol SFS_STR_BUFF_DEF, and set
    32:                            it to 1. This actually takes place in header
    33:                            WaitForCarbonUnit_Pvt.H.
    34:     2015/10/04 2.4.0.8 DAG RestoreConsoleMode_WW: Consolidate functions
    35:                            RestoreConsoleModeA_WW and RestoreConsoleModeW_WW
    36:                            into a single thread-safe function.
    37:     ============================================================================
    38: */
    39:
    40: #define _DEFINING_WWCONAID_DLLMAIN
    41: #include ".\WaitForCarbonUnit_Pvt.H"
    42:
    43: #define WWCONAID_MTX_SPIN_COUNT         0x00001000L
    44:
    45:
    46: LPCRITICAL_SECTION m_hHandleStateGuard = NULL;
    47:
    48:
    49: /*******************************************************************************
    50:
    51:    Function:    DllMain ( HANDLE , DWORD , LPVOID )
    52:
    53:    Synopsis:    DllMain is called by Windows when the DLL is initialized,
    54:                 Thread Attached, and other times. Refer to SDK documentation,
    55:                 as to the different ways this may be called.
    56:
    57:                 The DllMain function should perform additional initialization
    58:                 tasks required by the DLL.  In this example, no initialization
    59:                 tasks are required.  DllMain should return a value of 1 if
    60:                 the initialization is successful.
    61:
    62: *******************************************************************************/
    63:
    64: BOOL APIENTRY DllMain ( HANDLE  phInst ,
    65:                         DWORD   pul_reason_being_called ,
    66:                         LPVOID  plpReserved )

    60: {
0F933E80  push        ebp                                                       ; EBP=0014E7BC                                                                                                                                ESP=0014E794
0F933E81  mov         ebp,esp                                                   ; EBP=0014E794                                                                                                                                ESP=0014E794
0F933E83  sub         esp,0D8h                                                  ; ESP=0014E6BC    Appropriate 0D8h = 216 bytes = 54 machine words, for working storage.                                                       ESP=0014E6BC
0F933E89  push        ebx                                                       ; EBX=004325C0                                                                                                                                ESP=0014E6B8
0F933E8A  push        esi                                                       ; ESI=0014E7D4                                                                                                                                ESP=0014E6B4
0F933E8B  push        edi                                                       ; EDI=0014EE50                                                                                                                                ESP=0014E6B0
     1: //  ============================================================================
     2: //  File Name:          SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI.C
     3: //
     4: //  Abstract:           This routine is a wrapper for SHS_GetStdHandleFNW, which
     5: //                      is decorated with __declspec ( DllExport ), but is
     6: //                      devoid of a calling convention designation and, hence,
     7: //                      adheres to the old __cdecl calling convention. Though I
     8: //                      could live with that, since the default calling
     9: //                      convention of a Platform Invoke thunk is __stdcall, I
    10: //                      wrote this wrapper, so that I wouldn't have to disturb
    11: //                      the existing calls to SHS_GetStdHandleFNW.
    12: //
    13: //  Remarks:            Since it was created specifically to support a managed
    14: //                      caller, SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI saves LastError into a
    15: //                      module variable, and provides SHS_GetStdHandleFNError,
    16: //                      in lieu of the managed wrapper, for retrieving it.
    17: //
    18: //                      The other reason for leaving the existing function
    19: //                      prototypes is that it made a nice test case to prove and
    20: //                      demonstrate my better DLL header.
    21: //  ============================================================================
    22:
    23: //  ============================================================================
    24: //  2015/10/15: The objective of the following comment is to strip the
    25: //              decorations from the function name when the linkage editor
    26: //              generates the table of exports. Initially, this edit was
    27: //              applied to GetOsVersionInfo, while SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI seemed
    28: //              to link without it. But, alas, no more!
    29: //
    30: //              IMPORTANT:  The spacing of this comment is very particular. The
    31: //                          white space that I prefer to put around parentheses
    32: //                          and commas breaks it. As straightforward as this one
    33: //                          is, I can live with the limitation.
    34: //  ============================================================================
    35:
    36: #pragma comment(linker, "/EXPORT:SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI=_SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI@4")
    37: #pragma comment(linker, "/EXPORT:SHS_GetStdHandleFNError=_SHS_GetStdHandleFNError@0")
    38:
    39: #define UNICODE
    40:
    41: #if !defined ( __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__ )
    42:     #define __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__
    43: #endif /* #if !defined ( __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__) */
    44:
    45: #define __WWCONAID_BUILDING_STDIN_WRAPPERS__
    46:
    47: #include <StandardHandleState.H>
    48: #include ".\WWConAid_Pvt.H"
    49: #include <OleAuto.h>
    50: #include ".\resource.h"
    51:
    52: #define WWCA_TS_FORCE_COTASKMALLOC  ( FB_STRING_BUFFER_INDEX_5_OF_5 + ARRAY_NEXT_ELEMENT_P6C )
    53:

003E59A3  call        001ACA7C  												; >	WWConAid.dll!SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI(const _SHS_STANDARD_HANDLE penmStdHandleID, unsigned char * plpOutputBuffer, int pintOutBufSize) Line 64	C

--- c:\users\dave\documents\programming\visual_studio_6\dll\wwconaid\shs_getstdhandlefncli.c 
     1: //	============================================================================
     2: //	File Name:			SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI.C
     3: //
     4: //	Abstract:			This routine is a wrapper for SHS_GetStdHandleFNW, which
     5: //						is decorated with __declspec ( DllExport ), but is
     6: //						devoid of a calling convention designation and, hence,
     7: //						adheres to the old __cdecl calling convention. Though I
     8: //						could live with that, since the default calling
     9: //						convention of a Platform Invoke thunk is __stdcall, I
    10: //						wrote this wrapper, so that I wouldn't have to disturb
    11: //						the existing calls to SHS_GetStdHandleFNW.
    12: //
    13: //	Remarks:            Since it was created specifically to support a managed
    14: //						caller, SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI saves LastError into a
    15: //						module variable, and provides SHS_GetStdHandleFNError,
    16: //						in lieu of the managed wrapper, for retrieving it.
    17: //
    18: //						The other reason for leaving the existing function
    19: //						prototypes is that it made a nice test case to prove and
    20: //						demonstrate my better DLL header.
    21: //	============================================================================
    22: 
    23: //	============================================================================
    24: //	2015/10/15:	The objective of the following comment is to strip the
    25: //              decorations from the function name when the linkage editor
    26: //              generates the table of exports. Initially, this edit was
    27: //              applied to GetOsVersionInfo, while SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI seemed
    28: //              to link without it. But, alas, no more!
    29: //
    30: //				IMPORTANT:	The spacing of this comment is very particular. The
    31: //							white space that I prefer to put around parentheses
    32: //							and commas breaks it. As straightforward as this one
    33: //							is, I can live with the limitation.
    34: //	============================================================================
    35: 
    36: #pragma comment(linker, "/EXPORT:SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI=_SHS_GetStdHandleFNCLI@12")
    37: #pragma comment(linker, "/EXPORT:SHS_GetStdHandleFNError=_SHS_GetStdHandleFNError@0")
    38: 
    39: #define UNICODE
    40: 
    41: #if !defined ( __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__ )
    42:     #define __WWCONAIDLIB_PVT_P6C__
